intro: Corispermum dutreuilii var. montanum, commonly known as the mountain corispermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are typically alternate and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations to harsh environmental conditions.
